file_content.text: Your work freeing those hostages saved a lot of soldiers, too. I'm sorry I lumped you in with the rest of your order.
Thanks for your help with the hostages. Getting rid of that artillery saves us a lot of pain on the battlefield.
My forward observers let me know as soon as the last hostage was clear. I'm impressed that you pulled it off.
I may have misjudged you, Jedi.
I'm glad I found someone who knows how to follow up talk with action.
Now we can call in an air strike and take out that artillery at last.
My concern was getting the hostages out alive.
I'm glad everyone's safe.
Mine too. I'm glad we were in agreement on that score.
Anyone else would do the same.
I respect humility in a soldier.
I don't say thanks often--ask my men--but I appreciate what you've done. We'll be a lot safer with that artillery out of the way.
Next time, do it yourself.
Trust me, we won't come looking for you.
Unless you can "magic" the rest of those hostages out of the hotel, you'd better be heading back there double-time.
I know you're working hard, but there are still hostages inside. We need them all out.
Get your squad out of artillery range, Simmons! Move it!
The Empire controls the whole battlefield now. Look for yourself.
I'm a soldier, I signed up for this, but Jedi... there's a lot of innocent people in the Daoba Hotel that never wanted to be part of your war.
I'm here to assist, Colonel, but I need to know the situation--not just who to blame.
I want to help them, and you.
The Empire's using hostages as shields. That's the situation.
The Empire declared war on the whole Republic, not just the Jedi.
This isn't just our war.
Everyone knows the Sith attacked to get back at you-- but it's us who suffer.
I know you Havoc boys are trained for every situation, but the Daoba Hotel is bad on top of worse.
I like a good challenge, Colonel. How bad are we talking?
A bad situation can be fun.
The Empire's taken a slew of hostages--part of their bold new experiment in civilian shields.
So don't get comfy--the Imps can see us from the Daoba Hotel, and they'll shell here soon.
If you know where the battery is, why not call in an airstrike and take it out?
Shelling can be stopped.
Normally, that's exactly what we'd do--but we can't risk all the civilian casualties.
What would the Empire want with a hotel?
The Daoba Hotel?
Besides being a prime location for their big guns, it's given the Empire a slew of hostages to use against us.
It's a war, bad stuff happens.
I'd expect a response like that from a Jedi--all mumbo jumbo and no action. Let me spell it out for you.
I've got a hostage situation and all you can offer is a smart response?
When they took over that hotel, the Empire locked the guests in their rooms and loaded artillery on the roof.
Any bombardment would kill the hostages, and any troop assault gets pounded by the artillery. They've completely tied our hands.
The Empire won't be expecting one person--I'll get the hostages out.
I can free the hostages.
All right. I'll give you a chance.
The Empire's looking for troops, not a small strike team. We'll get the hostages out.
We can free the hostages.
I like your attitude.
My observers will let me know when you get all the hostages clear, then we can take the artillery out with an airstrike.
Surely there's a way to deal with the artillery without endangering the hostages.
There must be other solutions.
I've got an idea...
Too bad for you.
That's where you're wrong, Jedi; as far as I'm concerned this whole war's your fault.
If you want to prove me wrong, go into the hotel and get the hostages out so we can end this fight.
I don't have to prove anything to you, but that's no reason for the hostages to suffer.
I'll do it for them, not you.
Shelling's a problem for all of us, but I've got an idea.
The Empire's expecting a full frontal assault; they won't be looking for someone sneaking in.
If you can get the hostages free, we can take the artillery out as soon as everyone's clear of the hotel.
I'll have the hostages out as soon as possible.
They'll be free before sunset.
Just get them out safe, that's more important than speed.
Watch how easy this is for me.
Actions impress me, not words. You get everyone out safe and I'll be impressed.
Watch yourself once you get inside, the hostages are probably well guarded. I'll see you once it's done.
Call in your air strike. A few hostages won't be missed.
Let them die. [Refuse quest]
I should have guessed that would be your response when I saw you slinking around the rear echelon. Blasted coward.
War's like dejarik; if you control the board, you control the game. Unfortunately, right now they control the board.
